I agree with Jillayne Schlicke in the fact that you should “invest in your brain”. I would say it differently….invest in yourself. Do you consider yourself an expert in real estate or do you have other skills you could capitalize on by starting your own business? Go with your strengths….if you know enough about the real estate market then dive into that. Personally, I would avoid real estate right now because it seems the market has peaked right now (based on several factors, the easiest to follow being $VNQ (the vanguard reit ETF….chart attached). If you have a good skill set for flipping houses then that chart doesn't matter too much. But if you know how to do something else in a way you'd find profitable, I would go with that. If you want ideas, tell me what you're good at and I'll help you brainstorm.
